titleStmt.title: Payton Moore et al. to unknown
CWG6557

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned who Comprised the Jury who rendered the verdict of guilty against Lemuell Hammons for maliciously shooting and wounding Thos Price, would respectfully unite with those signing his petition for Executive Clemency -- towards said Hammons, & we further add that the proof showed that the shooting occured more than two years since that Price did not nor has not suffered any material or permanent injury there from, & that after the shooting occured Price administered a severe and cruel beating to Hammon --

Payton Moore
Wm Neal
Smith Moar
North Morgan
James E Willis
W g Cole
W. D. Wilson
John Leathers
The undersigned members of the Bar unite in the prayer of the petitioners

W H Smith
Jas. D Hardin
John Draffen
Tho C Bell
Th N Lindsey
John F Wilis
James M Posey
